title: Caffe2 for production

labels.name: wontfix
labels.description: This will not be worked on

body:
When we are ready to run inference in production, we might want to do it using Caffe2.

This my wrap up of ideas found in:
- https://developers.facebook.com/blog/post/2018/05/02/announcing-pytorch-1.0-for-research-production/
- https://pytorch.org/tutorials/advanced/super_resolution_with_caffe2.html
- https://devclass.com/2018/12/11/pytorch-1-released-with-jit-and-hint-of-caffe/
- https://pytorch.org/tutorials/beginner/Intro_to_TorchScript.html
- https://pytorch.org/blog/pytorch-1.2-and-domain-api-release/

As of version 1.0, developers can use PyTorch's `imperative` declaration mode to test and experiment; they can also export a model to `declarative` execution modes (aka statically typed graph representation) for production.  

The migration from PyTorch to Caffe2 to ship to production used to be a manual process.  To solve this problem ... developers can share models among different frameworks with ONNX, such as by exporting models built in PyTorch and importing them to Caffe2.

PyTorch has continued to add features to support both research and production usage, including the ability to bridge these two worlds via TorchScript ... With PyTorch 1.2, the open source ML framework takes a major step forward for production usage with the addition of an improved and more polished TorchScript environment. These improvements make it even easier to ship production models, expand support for exporting ONNX formatted models ...
